main event: A witness observed a glowing, deep red object approximately 20 feet in diameter follow a westerly course at around 1,000 feet above the ground for about 3 minutes in Spring Valley, Ohio in September 1966.
interesting points: The object made a sharp turn to the north and accelerated to a very high rate of speed, disappearing from view in seconds.
The object gave the impression of solid metal construction and appeared to be under intelligent control.
There were no visible means of propulsion or external lights/appendages on the object.
The witness was unable to determine the exact size or altitude, but it was clearly visible to the naked eye and was not an aircraft, missile, or any known aerial vehicle.
The experience left a vivid and lasting impression, increasing the witness's interest in the UFO phenomenon.
sighted object: a glowing, deep red object approximately 20 feet in diameter
